message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR 

This paper proposes a framework for sentiment analysis of documents (speeches, news articles, etc.) based on the sentiments expressed towards different topics. This falls under the domain of natural language processing and machine learning, which are covered by several sub-categories in arXiv CS. Specifically, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category as it deals with natural language processing and sentiment analysis. The paper also uses machine learning techniques, which are covered by sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of sentiment analysis for political ideology detection, which could fall under sub-categories such as cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
